thread.section_title: Arsenal and Manchester United will miss out on top four finish, says Jamie Redknapp – Metro
thread.title: Arsenal and Manchester United will miss out on top four finish, says Jamie Redknapp
thread.title_full: Arsenal and Manchester United will miss out on top four finish, says Jamie Redknapp

author: louissealey1
title: Arsenal and Manchester United will miss out on top four finish, says Jamie Redknapp
text:
Manchester United and Arsenal face missing out on the top four (Picture: Getty) Premier League giants Arsenal and Manchester United will miss out on the top four this season, according to Jamie Redknapp.
Arsene Wenger’s Gunners are in disarray, losing four of their five league games since the turn of the year while also crashing out of Europe.
Arsenal make offer to world class manager about replacing Arsene Wenger The north London outfit failed to close the gap on the top four on Saturday, falling to a 3-1 defeat to Tony Pulis’ West Brom.
The defeat leaves Arsenal four points adrift of fourth-place Liverpool, who drew to Manchester City on Sunday, and two behind Jose Mourinho’s United.
The Red Devils continued their impressive run in the top-flight with a 3-1 victory at relegation-battlers Middlesbrough at the weekend.
However, despite moving up to fifth, Redknapp believes United will miss out on a Champions League finish at the end of the campaign, along with the Gunners.
Manchester United fixtures West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sun 9 Apr
Anderlecht (A) – Thu 13 Apr
Chelsea (H) – Sun 16 Apr
Anderlecht (H) – Thu 20 Apr
Burnley (A) – Sun 23 Apr
Man City (A) – Thu 27 April
Swansea (A) – Sun 30 April
When asked which teams will finish outside of the top four, Redknapp told Sky Sports: I think Arsenal will miss out, possible United as well.
‘From Liverpool’s point of view to keep that run going against the top sides is fantastic.
More: Football Monaco star will reject Manchester United to sign for Chelsea 
Chile set to RISK Alexis Sanchez despite Arsenal's ligament damage fears 
Irish footballer and Derry City captain Ryan McBride dies aged 27 
‘Now though you are in the lap of the gods. You hope all your players come back from international duty fresh and with no injuries because there are so many important games to come.
‘Man City go against Arsenal next and then Chelsea before facing Southampton. There are big games to come but both Man City and Liverpool will finish in the top four.’
MORE: Arsene Wenger told me he’s staying at Arsenal, reveals Pulis
